A Constraint_occurrence is a type of that limits possible solutions to the requirements specification by identifying boundary conditions for any potential solution. A Constraint_occurrence may be a .
A constraint is simply a logical relation among several unknowns (or variables), each taking a value in a given domain. A constraint thus restricts the possible values that variables can take, it represents some partial information about the variables of interest. For instance, "the circle is inside the square" relates two objects without precisely specifying their positions, i.e., their coordinates. Now, one may move the square or the circle and he or she is still able to maintain the relation between these two objects. Also, one may want to add other object, say triangle, and introduce another constraint, say "square is to the left of the triangle". From the user (human) point of view, everything remains absolutely transparent.
Constraints naturally enjoy several interesting properties:
* constraints may specify partial information, i.e., constraint need not uniquely specify the values of its variables, * constraints are non-directional, typically a constraint on (say) two variables X, Y can be used to infer a constraint on X given a constraint on Y and vice versa, * constraints are declarative, i.e., they specify what relationship must hold without specifying a computational procedure to enforce that relationship, * constraints are additive, i.e., the order of imposition of constraints does not matter, all that matters at the end is that the conjunction of constraints is in effect, * constraints are rarely independent, typicaly constraints in the constraint store share variables.
Constraints arise naturally in most areas of human endeavor. The three angles of a triangle sum to 180 degrees, the sum of the currents floating into a node must equal zero, the position of the scroller in the window scrollbar must reflect the visible part of the underlying document, these are some examples of constraints which appear in the real world. Thus, constraints are a natural medium for people to express problems in many fields. Reference: http://kti.ms.mff.cuni.cz/~bartak/constraints/intro.html

An Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship is the association between one and another, with a defined type of relationship. An Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship is an incompletely modeled concept and shall be combined with members of to form a complete requirement.

the related_requirement_occurrence specifies the first for the Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship. The first Ee_requirement_occurrence is the dependent item if the relationship is a dependency relationship.

the relating_requirement_occurrence specifies the second for the Operational_requirement_occurrence_relationship. The second Ee_requirement_occurrence is the independent item if the relationship is a dependency relationship.

the relationship_type specifies one of the following:
an AND_OPERATION an OR_OPERATION a DERIVED_FROM relationship The mathematical operations AND, OR shall be implemented for this relationship_type. DERIVED_FROM only asserts a dependency relationship. The AND_OPERATION is provided so that changes in relationship_type from OR_OPERATION to AND_OPERATION do not cause a structural change to the populated data. The implicit relationship between two member of Ee_requirement_occurrence that help to compose the same Requirement_group_occurrence is an AND relationship.

A Structured_text_id_in_document is a set of detailed information whose location in a document is directly referenced. The information is in the form of text, tables, and graphics in a human readable language, although the hard copy may be a report from computer interpretable files. The same information may be included in multiple documents in different locations, and in that case different Structured_text_id_in_document would be populated for each document. This Application Object supports the case where it is necessary to identify the different locations within the same document that a set of information exists.
the document specifies the that is the container for the information referenced by Structured_text_id_in_document.
the text specifies the unique that is the information for the Structured_text_id_in_document.
the identifier specifies the label that is the identification within the document of the referenced by text for the Structured_text_id_in_document.

A Test_requirement_occurrence is a type of that specifies a test related requirement. The test method shall be specified in the requirement_specification inherited from Ee_requirement_occurrence. The Test_requirement_occurrence provides a representation of minimum bounds on behaviour. In order to relate a Test_requirement_occurrence to a product, a is required to be exchanged that references this Application Object and the version of the product to which the test requirement is allocated. That shall also specify a number of Part_feature_analytical_model_port_assignment in order to specify the measurement access points for the test. It is valid to exchange a Test_requirement_occurrence without a Either an shall be provided or a shall be provided.
This edition of this part of ISO 10303 does not explicitly relate the test requirement to the test setup.
